skill.description: Use when working with Payload CMS projects (payload.config.ts, collections, fields, hooks, access control, Payload API). Use when debugging validation errors, security issues, relationship queries, transactions, or hook behavior.

security_audit.summary: The skill content is documentation and examples for Payload CMS usage. No data access, execution, or exfiltration behavior is present.

content.user_title: Build Payload CMS configs and APIs faster
content.value_statement: Payload CMS setup and access control can be confusing in large projects. This skill provides clear patterns and examples for collections, fields, hooks, and queries.
actual_capabilities: Explain collection configuration, auth, uploads, and drafts patterns
Guide field definitions, validation, and admin UI options
Provide hook patterns with transaction safety and context control
Explain access control and row level filtering strategies
Show Local API, REST, and GraphQL query examples
Outline plugin architecture and extension points
limitations: Does not run code or connect to databases
Does not generate or modify project files automatically
Does not provide hosting or deployment steps
Does not manage secrets or credentials

use_cases.title: Model content schema
use_cases.description: Design collections, fields, and relationships with validation and admin display guidance.

use_cases.title: Secure content access
use_cases.description: Implement access control rules and safe Local API usage for user scoped data.

use_cases.title: Extend Payload safely
use_cases.description: Plan plugin structure, hooks, and custom endpoints with best practice patterns.

prompt_templates.title: Start a collection
prompt_templates.prompt: Draft a basic Posts collection with title, slug, author relationship, and draft status. Include admin list columns and timestamps.

prompt_templates.title: Add access rules
prompt_templates.prompt: Write access control for posts so admins see all, authors see their own, and public can read published only.

prompt_templates.title: Fix hook behavior
prompt_templates.prompt: My afterChange hook updates another collection and breaks transactions. Show the correct pattern with req threading.

prompt_templates.title: Design a plugin
prompt_templates.prompt: Outline a plugin that adds a field to selected collections and injects a beforeChange hook while preserving existing hooks.

output_examples.input: Explain how to enforce access control in Local API calls
output: Local API bypasses access control by default
Set overrideAccess to false when acting as a user
Use role checks or row level filters in access functions
Keep admin tasks explicit about bypassing access control

best_practices: Share your Payload config context and adapter choice
State user roles and access control intent clearly
Include relevant hook and collection snippets
anti_patterns: Requesting secret keys or credentials in prompts
Using Local API with user context but no overrideAccess false
Providing vague errors without a stack or code location

faq.question: Is this compatible with Payload 3.x and Next.js app router?
faq.answer: Yes. The guidance targets Payload 3.x and Next.js native app integration patterns.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It provides guidance and examples only. It does not run code or access your environment.

faq.question: Can it integrate with my existing Payload project?
faq.answer: Yes. Provide your config and schema details to tailor advice to your setup.

faq.question: Does it access my data or secrets?
faq.answer: No. It does not access files, environment variables, or external services.

faq.question: How do I troubleshoot unexpected access control results?
faq.answer: Share the access functions, Local API call options, and a sample user role to review.

faq.question: How does it compare to general coding assistants?
faq.answer: It focuses on Payload specific patterns, pitfalls, and configuration details.
